descriptions: Student identifies only one or two basic emotions.
Student identifies several basic emotions but struggles with complex ones.
Student identifies a range of emotions, including some complex ones.
Student identifies a wide range of emotions, including nuanced and complex ones, and can explain the triggers for these emotions.

Student demonstrates exceptional ability to identify and articulate a comprehensive range of emotions, including subtle variations and complex emotional states, and thoroughly explains their triggers.
Student displays consistently inappropriate emotional responses.
Student sometimes shows appropriate emotional responses, but often struggles.
Student usually demonstrates appropriate emotional responses in familiar situations.
Student consistently demonstrates appropriate emotional responses in a variety of situations.
Student consistently demonstrates appropriate emotional responses, and adapts their responses based on the context of the situation.
Student consistently demonstrates exemplary emotional responses in all situations, adapting responses with exceptional awareness and empathy.
Student does not use any coping strategies.
Student attempts one or two coping strategies with little success.
Student uses some coping strategies with moderate success.
Student effectively uses a variety of coping strategies.
Student effectively uses a variety of coping strategies, and can explain why they are effective.
Student adeptly employs a diverse array of coping strategies, demonstrating a deep understanding of their effectiveness and customizing their approach with exceptional insight.
